summary: This is a brief email from a U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff member informing colleagues that Judge Alison J. Nathan has signed an order related to the Epstein case and it is ready to be picked up from her chambers.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Her clerk called to inform that she signed an order related to the Epstein case, and the signed order is ready to be picked up from her chambers.

events.title: Epstein 6(e) Order Signed
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan signed a court order related to the Epstein case, specifically referenced as a "6(e) Order," which typically pertains to grand jury secrecy rules.

keyFacts: A court order related to the Epstein case was signed by Judge Alison J. Nathan on January 31, 2020.
The order is referenced as a "6(e) Order," which is a legal term for an order concerning grand jury secrecy under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e).
The communication is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) coordinating the pickup of the signed order from the judge's chambers.
